title: Banks to focus on cost-cutting in third quarter results
text:
Britain's biggest banks will use the upcoming results season to manage shareholder expectations as they prioritise cutting costs over raising dividends, City analysts warned.

Taxpayer-controlled Royal Bank of Scotland is first out of the blocks on Thursday, followed by Barclays, HSBC, Standard Chartered and Lloyds.

Ian Gordon, of Investec, said he expects to see "more intense revenue pressures" and "weaker corporate activity" in the numbers.

Earlier this month it emerged that HSBC had made plans to cut up to 10,000 jobs, adding to the tens of thousands of bankers in Europe that have already lost their jobs this year.

"Last year every UK bank beat market expectations at third quarter," Mr...
description: Britain's biggest banks will use the upcoming results season to manage shareholder expectations as they prioritise cutting costs over raising dividends, City analysts warned.
